text:
What happened:
- The robot is still centered and away from the drawer unit on the right. It hasn’t approached or contacted a handle, so the task strategy (approach–grasp–pull) hasn’t begun. Likely the policy failed to detect/track the drawer handle or aborted the approach.

What to do next (high level):
- Re-localize the drawer and select the correct handle.
- Replan an approach to the right side: move the base/arm right, align the gripper with the handle height, orient the jaws to grasp, then execute a gentle grasp-and-pull.
- If perception is uncertain, take a closer viewpoint first, then proceed.
